p: Results demonstrated that the major pathogen from ‘Hongyang’ kiwifruit causing to anthracnose was C. acutatum. The inhibition of CEO against C. acutatum attributed to the reducing of fungal growth and spore germination. CEO could penetrate CW, and pass through the PM, and then interact with the membranous structures of cytoplasmic organelles. Moreover, the major components of CEO such as cinnamaldehyde could be used as a natural fungistat. The antifungal mechanism of cinnamaldehyde requires further investigations.
